DOC.brief_title: Tubal Flushing Using Water Soluble Media Unexplained Infertility
DOC.detailed_description: The potential therapeutic effect diagnostic tubal patency test debate 40 year . Tubal flushing might involve water- oil-soluble medium . Current practice usually involve water-soluble medium tubal flushing perform laparoscopy . A systematic review show significant increase pregnancy rate tubal flush use oil-soluble contrast medium compare treatment . Tubal flushing oil soluble contrast medium associated increase odds live birth compare tubal flush water-soluble medium . There trial assess tubal flush water-soluble medium versus treatment . The potential consequence extravasation oil-soluble contrast medium pelvic cavity fallopian tube may associate anaphylaxis lipogranuloma . It report Further randomise control trial need evaluate potentially therapeutic effect tubal flush water-soluble medium . All patient attend subfertility clinic infertility , normal semen analysis evidence ovulation invite participate study . The nature study expect value explain woman provide write consent include study . Three hundred woman divide 2 equal group use computer generate random number : Group 1 tubal flushing HSG use water soluble medium group 2 control group receive intervention . Women undergo HSG give 50 mg diclofenac ( Voltaren® Novartis ) 1 hour procedure . The HSG perform room , table technique maintain consistency limit confound variable . The HSG procedure perform lithotomy position . A sterile metal speculum use visualize uterine cervix . Antiseptic solution use wash vagina cervix . A single-toothed tenaculum place anterior lip cervix . A metal cannula gently insert external cervical o , cannula tenaculum secure together , speculum remove . Gentle traction place tenaculum , 15 mL 20 mL water-soluble medium ( Sodium Amidotrizoate ; urografin® , Bayer , Germany ) instill slowly via cannula prevent pain necessary image obtain . After procedure , instrument remove patient observe 30 minute . Women follow monthly 1 year .
